metadata.title: CVE-2023-52790 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:swiotlb: fix out-of-bounds TLB allocations with CONFIG_SWIOTLB_DYNAMICLimit the free list length to the size of the IO TLB. Transient pool can besmaller than IO_TLB_SEGSIZE, but the free list is initialized with theassumption that the total number of slots is a multiple of IO_TLB_SEGSIZE.As a result, swiotlb_area_find_slots() may allocate slots past the end of atransient IO TLB buffer.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-52790` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
